intro: Jussiaea boydiana, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, thriving in coastal environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of salt-tolerant hairs. Jussiaea boydiana is well adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
